links.name: Google for Jobs
links.description:
Click on the big blue box at the top of search results when you Google for job openings. Google for Jobs is an enhanced search tool. It includes job listings from across almost all the major online job boards and listings on company websites. 

Google for Jobs provides specific search results alongside useful company information, such as online reviews and ratings, and job descriptions. Job seekers can create alerts for their narrowly-tailored individual keywords and filters.

links.name: LinkedIn Jobs
links.description: LinkedIn helps you find relevant jobs that suit your skills and qualifications. You can either search for a job using the search field on the top of the LinkedIn homepage or you can directly access the Jobs page where you can search and apply for jobs. Millions of jobs are posted on LinkedIn every day.

links.name: Indeed
links.description:
Indeed.com enables you to search millions of job listings from thousands of websites, job boards, newspapers, blogs, company career pages, and associations to find job listings that match or have similar terms related to your search query.

Not all of Indeed.com listings are on Google for Jobs.

links.name: PSJD
links.description: PSJD is the premier site for public interest and related job listing for lawyers.

links.name: USAJobs
links.description: The best starting place for jobs with the federal government.

links.name: The Ladders
links.description:
Upload your resume in .pdf or .doc format. Analyze
the content, structure, and style instantly. Actionable recommendations will make your resume work for you

links.name: Rezi
links.description:
AI-powered free resume builder is trusted by thousands of job seekers.
Create an ATS optimized resume and tailor it to any job application in only minutes.

links.name: LinkedIn Resume Builder
links.description:
Build a resume from your LinkedIn profile. Not particularly useful, but you can specify a job title for the job you are applying for, and LinkedIn will show you suggested keywords that are already in your LinkedIn profile.  It will also give you a list of suggested keywords to add to your LinkedIn profile and resume.

[If the link doesn't work, click on View profile. Click the More button on the introduction card. Select Build a resume from the dropdown.]

links.name: Ms. Career Girl Resume Optimization Tool
links.description: Analyze your resume in seconds.

links.name: Jessica Medina Financial Coaching
links.description: Jessica is Biglaw Exit Strategist and former Biglaw attorney who specializes in creating financial strategies for lawyers looking to make a change. You don’t have to be in Biglaw (or even a lawyer) to work with Jessica, but you may hear a lot of Biglaw stories!

links.name: Ultimate List of 80+ LinkedIn Voices Job Seekers Should Follow
links.description: General job search experts active on LinkedIn. The people on this list have stood out for sharing posts and articles; commenting on others’ content; producing video, YouTube, and podcasts; and overall providing sage advice on the job search. In short, they engage with their community.

links.name: Glassdoor
links.description: Besides being a job search site, Glassdoor has one of the broadest salary calculators based on self-reported salaries.
A great resource for research on almost 1000 (mostly) Big Law offices.
links.name: NALP Directory of Legal Employers
Upstract
links.description: News aggregator with feeds from dozens of news sources including the NY Times, Wash Post, AP, CNN, Huff Post, Axios, NBC, CBS, ABC, Fox, MSNBC, and many more. Also includes user-curated news and Youtube, Twitter, and Google Trending news.

links.name: Lawyer Career Tweeters
links.description: Twitter list of over 150 tweeters who focus on job search and career matters relevant for lawyers in career transition.

links.name: General Career Tweeters
links.description: Twitter list of over 150 tweeters who focus on general job search and career topics relevant for lawyers in career transition.

links.name: StartMe
links.description: Customizable dashboard to create personalized webpage aggregating and organizing feeds from all your favorite sites with rollover feature to preview each item in your feed.

links.name: Professional Prosperity for Lawyers
links.description: Shows the process for lawyers to find the perfect job and create your ideal career.

links.name: Namecheap
links.description: Website domain names from $.99 ($8.00 for .com) along with add-on economical web hosting, email, and other services.

links.name: Bluehost
links.description: Fast, easy, and secure WordPress hosting in minutes. Automatic WordPress install and updates. Free SSL certificate included. Free domain name for 1st Year. Starting at $3.95/month.

links.name: Jobscan
links.description: Start by uploading your current resume. Then add a job description to see tips for optimizing your resume. Analyzes from ATS, recruiter, skills, keyword, and other perspectives.

links.name: LinkedIn Career Explorer
links.description: The path to a new job isn’t always clear. There are jobs that are a great fit but might seem out of reach, and others you may not even know you have the skills for. LinkedIn is now putting the power of their data in your hands: uncover potential career paths and see how your skills match to real job titles.

links.name: Google Alerts
links.description: Google service which sends emails to the user when it finds new results—such as web pages, newspaper articles, blogs, or scientific research—that match the user's search term.

links.name: Fishbowl
links.description:
The Fishbowl app is where professionals go to connect and talk in a new era of remote work.

Choose from thousands of Industry, Community or Company Bowls ("Groups") and have honest conversations with other verified professionals that are working in roles and industries similar to your own.

You can join different bowls or professional groups with others from the same background as yourself to get real advice, share work stories, and network.

links.name: Exit From Work: What Will The New You Look Like?
links.description: This is the time when “60” is truly the new “40.” What does this mean for you? This book walks you through the many new options you have available in today’s opportunity-expansive world. It just takes “knowing” where to look. EXIT FROM WORK is brimming with actionable ideas to help you redefine the typical conceptions about work and retirement that is now seen as optional by millions of people who are living strong, healthy lives longer.
